text: Vihuela is a name given to two different guitar-like string instruments: one from 16th century Spain, usually with 12 paired strings, and the other, the Mexican vihuela, from 20th century Mexico with five strings and typically played in Mariachi bands. == Other websites == * lutesandguitars.co.uk Stephen Barber & Sandi Harris, lutemakers and researchers * vihuelademano.com Alexander Batov, vihuela maker and researcher * Goldberg magazine: Los dos rinacimintos de la vihuela The twentieth-century resuscitation of the vihuela. * Several photos of Spanish vihuelas can be found among the instrument photos at Wayne Cripps' lute pages. * Pictures Category:Plucked string instruments
title: Vihuela
